content.title: Sanjay Gandhi Niradhar Grant Scheme
content.department: Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance
content.beneficiary: Families Below Poverty Line (BPL) and persons with disabilities
content.details: The Sanjay Gandhi Niradhar Grant Scheme provides financial assistance to families Below Poverty Line (BPL) and persons with disabilities to support their living expenses.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹600/- per month for one beneficiary
Financial assistance of ₹900/- per month for more than one beneficiary
Support for orphan children and persons with disabilities
eligibility: Families must be Below Poverty Line (BPL)
Women in the process of divorce can apply
Persons with Sickle Cell Disease are eligible
exclusions: Only permanent residents of Maharashtra can apply
Applicants from neighboring states are not eligible
content.application_process: This scheme accepts both offline and online applications.
documents_required: Proof of Identity: PAN Card, Voter ID Card, Passport, Aadhaar Card, Driving License, Government ID
Proof of Address: Ration Card, Aadhaar Card, Driving License, Voter ID, Utility Bills
Residential Certificate / Domicile Certificate of Maharashtra

faqs.question: How Much Shall Be The Maximum Amount Of Financial Assistance In Case There Is Only One Beneficiary In The Family?
faqs.answer: The maximum amount of financial assistance shall be ₹600/- per month in case there is only one beneficiary in the family.

faqs.question: Can Only Families Who Are Below Poverty Line Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, in order to be eligible for this scheme, the family should be Below Poverty Line (BPL).

faqs.question: Can Orphan Children Also Apply?
faqs.answer: Yes, Orphan Children can also apply to this scheme.

faqs.question: Does This Scheme Accept Applications From Transgenders?
faqs.answer: Yes, Transgenders too can apply to this scheme.

faqs.question: Is There Any Application Fee?
faqs.answer: No, the entire application process is entirely free of cost.

faqs.question: Can Applicants From The Neighboring States Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Telangana, Etc Also Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only the citizens who are permanent residents of the state of Maharashtra are eligible to apply.
